items

Class Trap

  • java.lang.Object
    • screen.ScreenObject
      • items.Item
        • items.Trap

  • public class Trap
extends Item
    Represents a trap in the maze which is an item that hurts the officer.
    Author:
    Dhruv Lohani

    • Field Detail

      • NEAR_DIST

        public static final double NEAR_DIST
        NEAR_DIST is a constant that represents the distance between the trap. DEFECT_CHANCE represents the chance the trap "malfunctions" and does not harm the officer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFECT_CHANCE

        public static final double DEFECT_CHANCE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Trap

        public Trap(processing.core.PApplet marker,
            double x,
            double y,
            int type)
        Parameters:
        marker - the PApplet object with which to load images
        x - the x coord of the trap
        y - the y coord of the trap
        type - the type of the trap. There are 4 types of traps. Traps of type 1 simply change the health of the officer by 25. Traps of type 2 decrease the speed of the officer by 2 units in the X and Y direction. Traps of type 3 set the position of the officer back to the start Traps of type 4 makes the Grinch more powerful(not decided how).
